p:
As can be observed from Table 1, some extracts inhibited α-amylase with a higher potency than the standard acarbose. MES showed the highest α-amylase inhibitory activity with IC 50 2.39 ± 0.23 µg/mL. In our previous study
27 we have identified in the B-type procyanidin dimers (B1-B4), the main phenolic compounds in the alcoholic extracts of W. filifera seeds. In addition to those, in this study, three phenolic compounds have been identified, catechin, protocatechuic acid, and p-hydroxybenzoic acid.
